Ophthalmology uses many devices to monitor and record a patientâ€™s visual
function. After extracting historical information from a device, the
data must be de-identified before submitting to SOURCE, the Sight
OUtcomes Research CollaborativE
(<https://www.sourcecollaborative.org/>).

The two functions in the package DeIDmachinedata can be used, along with
crosswalks provided by IT, to complete the data preparation. The
functions loadxwalks() and fileDeID() are flexible enough to use with
data extracted from many devices.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`deidentify.cirrus()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/deidentify.cirrus.md)
  : De-identify Cirrus metadata exports
- [`deidentify.hfa()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/deidentify.hfa.md)
  : De-identify HFA data exports
- [`deidentify.metadata()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/deidentify.metadata.md)
  : De-identify tabular imaging metadata files
- [`deidentify.spectralis.pdf()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/deidentify.spectralis.pdf.md)
  : De-identify Spectralis PDF-derived data exports
- [`deidentify.spectralis.raw()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/deidentify.spectralis.raw.md)
  : De-identify Spectralis raw metadata exports
- [`fileDeID()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/fileDeID.md)
  : De-identify machine extraction data
- [`loadxwalks()`](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/reference/loadxwalks.md)
  : Load crosswalk(s) needed to de-identify machine data.

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Deidentifying a Flat
  File](https://chrisandrewsphd.github.io/DeIDmachinedata/articles/deidentifying_flatfile.md):
